meanings.definition: Deliberately avoid using or abstain from
meanings.sent1: I always eschew sugary drinks to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: She decided to eschew the shortcut and take the longer route.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to eschew the new brand of cat food, turning up its nose at it.
meanings.sent4: He made a conscious effort to eschew negative thoughts, focusing on the positive instead.
meanings.sent5: In order to save money, he had to eschew eating out and cook at home instead.

meanings.sent1: The shy student would always eschew large social gatherings.
meanings.sent2: The detective had to eschew the suspect in order to maintain objectivity.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel would eschew the noisy playground, preferring the quiet of the forest.
meanings.sent4: She had to eschew the temptation to peek at her presents before Christmas.
meanings.sent5: The old house was so haunted that people would eschew going near it at night.
